body_html:
Right, my mistake.

Re-reading the docs, I see that dim is in fact not a keyword argument, but an optional argument. I wrongly assumed the syntax was analogous to that in Numpy, i.e. numpy.max(a, axis=None, out=None, keepdims=<class 'numpy._globals._NoValue'>).

Closing, with thanks.

Right, my mistake.
Re-reading the docs, I see that dim is in fact not a keyword argument, but an optional argument. I wrongly assumed the syntax was analogous to that in Numpy, i.e. numpy.max(a, axis=None, out=None, keepdims=<class 'numpy._globals._NoValue'>).
Closing, with thanks.
body:
Right, my mistake. 

Re-reading the docs, I see that `dim` is in fact not a keyword argument, but an optional argument. I wrongly assumed the syntax was analogous to that in Numpy, i.e. `numpy.max(a, axis=None, out=None, keepdims=<class 'numpy._globals._NoValue'>)`.

Closing, with thanks.
